itemDescription: British soldier and Conservative Party politician

wikipedia_page.main: John Sidney North PC (28 May 1804 – 11 October 1894), known as John Doyle until 1838, was a British soldier and Conservative Party politician. He was a Member of Parliament (MP) for 33 years.

response: The peerage remained in abeyance for thirty-nine years, until the abeyance was terminated in 1841 in favour of the late Earl's second daughter Susan North, who became the tenth holder. She was the wife of John North, a Colonel in the Army and Member of Parliament. Born John Doyle, he had assumed the surname of North in lieu of Doyle in 1838. The title descended in the direct line until the death of her great-great-grandson, the thirteenth Baron (who had succeeded his grandfather), in 1941. Lord North was killed in action as a member of the crew of HMS Neptune. On his death the barony fell into abeyance between his two sisters, Dorothy Anne Graham (1915-2011) and Susan Silence Beauchamp (1920-1999).

response: *John North (died 1597) (1551–1597), MP for Cambridgeshire, Cambridge and Orford
*John North (16th century MP), Member of Parliament for City of York
*John North (billiards player), World Champion of English billiards in the 20th century, see World Professional Billiards Championship
*John North (American football) (1921–2010), original Baltimore Colts player and New Orleans Saints head coach
*John North (Trinity) (1645–1683), Master of Trinity College, Cambridge 1677–1683
*John North (theologian) (1871–1950), New Zealand Baptist minister, editor and theological college principal
